description: Creates a new configuration set. After you create the configuration set, you can add one or more event destinations to it. A configuration set is a set of rules that you apply to the SMS and voice messages that you send. When you send a message, you can optionally specify a single configuration set.

parameters.name: ConfigurationSetName
parameters.description: The name to use for the new configuration set.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: An array of key and value pair tags that's associated with the new configuration set. (dict) --- The list of tags to be added to the specified topic. The key identifier, or name, of the tag. The string value associated with the key of the tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key identifier, or name, of the tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The string value associated with the key of the tag.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If you don't specify a client token, a randomly generated token is used for the request to ensure idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationSetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the newly created configuration set.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationSetName
nested_items.description: The name of the new configuration set.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: An array of key and value pair tags that's associated with the configuration set.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key identifier, or name, of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The string value associated with the key of the tag.

nested_items.name: CreatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the configuration set was created, in UNIX epoch time format.
